projectPurpose: To provide a fast and easy-to-use command-line tool for automatically formatting LaTeX source code files (.tex, .bib, .cls, .sty), improving readability and consistency, with a focus on speed and minimal configuration.
mainFeatures: Supports disabling formatting for specific lines or blocks
Can check formatting without modifying files
Option to not wrap long lines

alternatives.name: latexindent
mainFeatures: Modifies line breaks and performs text wrapping

alternatives.name: TeXstudio
mainFeatures: Assistants for tables, formulas, and images

alternatives.name: latex-formatter (VS Code extension)
mainFeatures: Integrates LaTeX formatting into VS Code
Often uses external formatters like latexindent
Easy access within the editor environment

marketPositioning: tex-fmt is positioned as an extremely fast and simple command-line LaTeX formatter. Its core differentiator is its speed, offering significantly faster performance than established tools like latexindent, particularly on large files. It targets users who prioritize performance and ease of use over extensive configuration options, fitting well into automated workflows, scripting, and CI/CD pipelines where speed is critical.
